data.title: Globalstar SmartOne C Satellite Tracker
data.meta_description: Globalstar SmartOne C is designed for the management of your powered or non-powered, fixed or movable assets. The SmartOne C is a cost-effective solution. Line or Battery Powered will automatically switch to battery backup when needed. Flexibility in messaging frequency configuration to track valuable assets.
data.text:
Satellite Asset Tracker Anti-Theft Device

SmartOne C is a satellite-managed asset-ready tracker designed for the intelligent management of fixed and mobile assets.

The SmartOne C is a practical solution for a multitude of options, including:

Up to 12 different reporting times

Interval or 24-hour operation mode

Alternate reporting schedules

Low battery message

Use the SmartOne C to track intermediate bulk containers, vehicles, boats, and trailers, improving your assets' operating efficiency and security.

The device can be line-powered, or the SmartOne C will automatically switch to battery backup in the absence or interruption of external power. When using line power, the user has maximum flexibility in messaging frequency, allowing for regular monitoring of asset location.

The SmartOne C utilises motion sensors, comparative GPS positions, and custom-configured sensors to gather and transmit asset status information. Each SmartOne C is adjusted to track your assets' needs and provide intermediate and emergency alerts by email or text.

Messaging

Staff Tip: Your tracking device can only operate with a messaging plan. Keep Track offers different plans to suit your needs.

STANDARD MESSAGING MODE

In Standard Messaging Mode, the SmartOne C reports its GPS position at regular intervals programmed during the initial configuration process. Reporting intervals can be programmed in 1-minute intervals from 35 minutes up to 45 days, and messages will be transmitted regardless of whether the asset is moving or stationary.

Alternatively, the device can be configured to send messages only when the asset is in motion, with messages transmitted as little as every 5 minutes.

REDUCED MESSAGING MODE

Reduced Messaging Mode reduces the cost of transmitting messages over the Globalstar satellite network by sending messages at a minimal message interval when the asset is stationary or in a defined area and transmitting at a higher message interval when the asset moves or changes locations.

THEFT RECOVERY/GEOFENCING MODE

The theft recovery mode allows you to configure the device to differentiate between authorised and unauthorised movements of an asset. While the asset remains in an authorised state, the SmartOne C will send out infrequent messages. Suppose the SmartOne C detects an unauthorised state, such as movement out of a predefined area. In that case, it can be programmed to send out high-frequency messages to enable the unauthorised movement to be monitored.

GEOFENCING

The SmartOne satellite asset tracker offers a geo-fencing feature. This feature enables you to predefine a set of geographic boundaries and receive email notifications when the device enters or exits the geo-fenced area.

Features

Up to 12 different reporting times

Interval or 24-hour operation mode

Alternate reporting schedules

Low battery message

Quick installation: Use industrial adhesives, brackets, or screw mounts for installation

Operates on 5V external line power, 8-22V regulator cable, or (4) AAA Lithium Batteries

Automatic alerts: Change of location sensing sends alerts if an asset moves outside of the pre-determined range

Messaging reduction mode: Reduces satellite messaging if the asset remains in the exact location for a pre-determined period

Hardware on/off feature: Allows the unit to initiate GPS re-centering functionality

Satellite technology: Global LEO Satellite operation using the Globalstar Simplex Data Network

Estimated Battery Life Expectancy:

01 Location Per Day (2.5 years)

02 locations Per Day (500 days)

03 locations Per Day (400 days)

06 Locations Per Day (200 Days)

24 Locations Per Day (80 Days)
